summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNED A 2014 CHRYSLER 200. WHILE DRIVING IN THE RAIN, THE SPEED WAS UNKNOWN BECAUSE THE SPEEDOMETER FAILED. THE CONTACT REAR ENDED THE PRECEDING VEHICLE THAT HAD STALLED AND THERE WERE NO WARNING INDICATORS ILLUMINATED. THE AIR BAGS FAILED TO DEPLOY. A POLICE REPORT WAS FILED. THE CONTACT SUSTAINED A FRACTURED RIGHT HIP, BRUISING, LACK OF MOTION IN THE RIGHT WRIST, A FRACTURED LEFT PELVIS, BRUISING TO THE LEFT KNEE, AND SEVERE BRUISING TO THE CHEST FROM HITTING THE WINDSHIELD. MEDICAL ATTENTION WAS RECEIVED. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO SUPERIOR TOWING COMPANY (2385 SW 66TH TERRACE, DAVIE, FL, 33317)  WHERE IS WAS DECLARED TOTALED BY THE INSURANCE COMPANY. THE CONTACT STATED THAT SHE NEVER RECEIVED NOTIFICATION OF NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 16V668000 (AIR BAGS, SEAT BELTS) AND WAS NOT MADE AWARE OF THE RECALL NOTIFICATION UNTIL JULY 19, 2017 AFTER SEARCHING ONLINE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 53,000....UPDATED 08/07/17 *BF UPDATED 08/11/17 *BF      *CN *TR
